Show HN: ChatGPT Bot Trained on Reddit Data
text:
I'm heavily relying on Reddit for my online research, but there are many repetitive questions and recommendations on subreddits, so I trained a GPT bot on over 100k r/BuyItForLife comments and posts to embody the collective knowledge of this Reddit community (and soon many other subreddits).

This could supplement Reddit and improve discussion quality. Currently, users often receive repeated answers or links to previous discussions. The tool would offer an initial answer and the option to post to Reddit if necessary.

Some posts I answered with the bot:

- Request Post: Dishwashers. What’s currently the best dishwasher for home use?

- Bot Answer: https://www.looria.com/bot?q=what%27s+currently+the+best+dis...

- Request Post : Recommendations for hiking shoes?

- Bot Answer: https://www.looria.com/bot?q=Recommendations+for+hiking+shoe...

------------

It's far from perfect and comes with limitations:

- Outdated information: I'll try to improve this by factoring in recency and some additional product information like prices, specs, etc, that I'm collecting. I also want to add more statistical significance to the results, e.g. by feeding in the amount of product recommendations over time.

- Hallucination: As always with these bots, they sometimes make things up. More training data should help here.

- Performance: Generating the answers is pretty slow and I'll look into improving this.

Take it with a grain of salt and look at it as a fun experiment :) Would love to hear your feedback!

Show HN: Conversation card game with endless AI-generated conversation starters
text:
Hi! I just finished the proof-of-concept version of the game and would love to get some feedback. I love conversation games but I don't like that you know all the cards after some time and then they lose their appeal. This conversation card game will keep generating new cards using AI :)

Some tips for playing:

* You need to create an account and log in to get the AI experience

* After you click "Like" on 20 cards the next cards will be a 50/50 mix of pre-existing cards and generated cards.

* The generated cards will be based on the cards you liked, if there is little variation in those cards all new cards will also show little variation

Ask HN: Recovering AWS root account without phone number – advice needed
text:
Hello everyone,

I'm posting here today because I've been unable to access my AWS account for the past 1 year due to a phone number issue. When I set up my account, I entered a bad phone number and now I can't recover my account because AWS requires both an email and phone number for account recovery.

I've already reached out to AWS support, and they've firstly asked me to provide a completed, signed, and certified Identity Verification Form and Affidavit. I provided it. Then they asked me other documentation to confirm the identity of the person who notarized or witnessed the form. I asked to mayor's agent to put something as proof, she put a city stamp but AWS support refuses it.

I'm wondering if anyone else has experienced a similar issue with recovering their AWS account and if they have any advice or tips on how to successfully recover it.

PS: I had fortunately created an AWS IAM root account so I am able to do many things but can't access to expenses/budgets details. The only way for me to get it is the monthly AWS expenses mail. That's more and more fsutraing.

Any help will be appreciated. Thanks.
